title: HIGHLIGHTS-Golf-U.S. Masters Day Three
text:
April 7, 2018 / 3:36 PM / Updated 2 hours ago HIGHLIGHTS-Golf-U.S. Masters Day Three Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
AUGUSTA, Ga., April 7 (Reuters) - Highlights from the third round of the 82nd U.S. Masters on Saturday: TIGER, PHIL OFF TO HORRIBLE STARTS 
Tiger Woods and Phil Mickelson, who together have a combined seven Green Jackets, are currently occupying the last two spots on the scoreboard after poor starts. Woods began his day with two consecutive bogeys while Mickelson went triple-bogey, bogey. RAIN GREETS EARLY STARTERS AT AUGUSTA NATIONAL 
Thunderstorms are in the forecast and could interrupt third-round action at Augusta National where a steady dose of rain greeted the early starters. READ MORE 
Reed storms into lead, Tiger just makes cut 
Leishman paints masterpiece to stay in hunt 
Garcia’s Masters defence sinks out of sight 
Ryder Cup warrior Reed ready to fly solo for Augusta glory 
Patience puts McIlroy in grand slam picture 
Lefty running out time in bid for fourth jacket (Reporting by Frank Pingue; Editing by John O’Brien and Christian Radnedge)
